name: Okta
description: Identity and access management — user provisioning, group management, session control, and access reviews

tools: get_user — Get user details, MFA status, groups
list_user_sessions — List active sessions for a user
revoke_sessions — Force logout all sessions for a user

setup_steps: 1. Create a dedicated service account in Okta
2. Generate API token: Security → API → Tokens → Create Token
3. Or use OAuth 2.0 for better security (recommended)
security_notes: API tokens inherit the permissions of the admin who creates them — use a least-privilege admin
Write operations (revoke sessions, suspend user) should require human approval
Token cannot be scoped to specific actions — use OAuth 2.0 for granular control
All Okta API calls appear in System Log — monitor for anomalies
Prefer OAuth 2.0 over API tokens for production MCP access
